In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            result *= "$line"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    return result * line
end
```
This function splits the input string into words, then iterates over each word. If adding a new word to the current line would exceed `text_width`, it starts a new line. The function finally appends any remaining words on the last line.

Here is an example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit"))
```
This will print:

```julia
"Lorem ipsum\ndolor sit amet,\nconsectetur adipiscing elit"
```
